data.title: Geography of Plano, Texas

data.text:
Plano, Texas

Plano, Texas is a bustling city located in the northern part of the state. It is situated in Collin County and covers an area of approximately 71 square miles. The city has a population of over 286,000 people as per the 2020 census. Plano lies within the Dallas-Fort Worth-Arlington metropolitan area and is one of the fastest-growing cities in Texas.

The geography of Plano is relatively flat with an elevation ranging from 525 to 700 feet above sea level. The city sits on top of Blackland Prairie soil, which makes it highly suitable for agricultural activities such as farming and ranching. Additionally, there are several lakes and reservoirs within Plano’s boundaries that provide recreational opportunities for residents and visitors alike. Demography of Plano, TX paints a picture of a city that’s not only growing fast, but also changing rapidly.

One notable geographical feature in Plano is its extensive network of parks and trails spanning over thousands of acres.

Climate of Plano, Texas

Plano, Texas is a city that experiences a humid subtropical climate. The region typically has hot summers and mild winters. In the summer months, the average temperature ranges from 90 to 100 degrees Fahrenheit and can be accompanied by high humidity levels.

During the winter months, temperatures tend to be in the range of 35-55 degrees Fahrenheit with occasional cold fronts dropping temperatures below freezing. Plano also experiences some rainfall throughout the year, with most precipitation occurring during spring and fall seasons.

The weather conditions in Plano have an impact on various aspects of daily life including outdoor activities, energy usage and even health. It is important for residents to stay informed about weather forecasts so they can plan their day-to-day activities accordingly. Overall, while Plano’s climate may present challenges at times, it also offers numerous opportunities for residents to enjoy a variety of outdoor recreational activities throughout the year.
